comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Roger Philip Bresnahan (June 11, 1879 – December 4, 1944), nicknamed "The Duke of Tralee" for his Irish roots, was an American player in Major League Baseball who starred primarily as a catcher and a player-manager. He was elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame in 1945. Bresnahan introduced the use of the catcher's shin guard in 1907. Bresnahan played for the Chicago Cubs from 1913–15.
